BRN00127_syn_1:
Indication: RUL Nodule.
Procedure: Ion Robotic Bronch + Radial EBUS.
Target: 1.5cm RUL apical nodule.
Actions: Navigated to lesion. Confirmed w/ r-EBUS (concentric). CBCT tool-in-lesion. Biopsy x6, Brush x2, BAL.
Result: Suspicious for carcinoma.
Plan: Oncology.
BRN00127_syn_2:
PROCEDURE NOTE: Robotic-Assisted Navigation Bronchoscopy.
Ms. [REDACTED] presented for biopsy of a PET-avid RUL nodule. The Ion robotic platform was utilized for navigation. Upon reaching the target in the RUL apical segment, radial EBUS confirmed a concentric solid lesion. Cone Beam CT verification demonstrated optimal tool placement. Transbronchial biopsies and brushings were obtained. Cytology suggests non-small cell carcinoma.
BRN00127_syn_3:
Coding:
- 31627: Navigation bronchoscopy (add-on).
- 31654: Peripheral EBUS (radial probe) for lesion localization (add-on).
- 31628: Transbronchial lung biopsy, single lobe.
Details: Robotic system used for guidance. Radial EBUS confirmed location. Biopsies taken of parenchymal nodule.

BRN00127_syn_5: robotic bronch for [REDACTED] that spot in the right upper lobe used the ion system drove out to the nodule radial ebus showed it nicely did a spin with the ct to be sure took a bunch of biopsies and a brush rose said it looks like cancer woke her up no issues.
BRN00127_syn_6: General anesthesia was induced. The Ion robotic bronchoscopy catheter was navigated to a 1.5 cm RUL nodule. Radial EBUS showed a concentric view. Cone beam CT confirmed tool-in-lesion. Transbronchial forceps biopsies and brushings were performed. BAL was also collected. No pneumothorax was observed.
BRN00127_syn_7:
[Indication]
1.5 cm RUL nodule.
[Anesthesia]
General.
[Description]

[Plan]

BRN00127_syn_8: We used the robotic bronchoscope to biopsy [REDACTED]. Once the robot guided us to the right upper lobe spot, we double-checked the location with the radial ultrasound probe and the CT spinner. Everything lined up perfectly. We took several biopsies and a brush sample. The preliminary check by the pathologist looked suspicious for cancer.
BRN00127_syn_9:
Procedure: Computer-guided bronchoscopy with peripheral sampling.
Target: RUL pulmonary lesion.
Verification: Radial ultrasonography and cone-beam tomography.
Technique: Forceps sampling and bronchial brushing.
Outcome: Diagnostic material obtained.
BRN00127:
PATIENT: [REDACTED]   MRN: [REDACTED]   DOB: [REDACTED]
DATE: [REDACTED]   LOCATION: Hybrid bronchoscopy suite
PROCEDURE: Ion robotic navigation bronchoscopy with radial EBUS and transbronchial lung biopsy of right upper lobe (RUL) nodule
INDICATION: 72-year-old female with a 1.5 cm spiculated RUL pulmonary nodule, PET-avid, no enlarged mediastinal nodes.

ANESTHESIA / AIRWAY:
General anesthesia with endotracheal intubation.

PROCEDURE SUMMARY (checklist style):
- Navigation platform: Ion robotic bronchoscopy
- Guidance: Pre-procedure CT loaded; virtual plan created to RUL apical segment nodule.
- Robotic scope advanced to target per navigational plan.
- Radial EBUS probe used: Concentric solid lesion pattern obtained.
- Imaging confirmation: Cone beam CT showed tool-in-lesion.
- Sampling tools: Transbronchial forceps biopsies (6 passes), brushings (2 passes), BAL (60 mL instilled, 30 mL return).
- No EBUS mediastinal staging performed.

No immediate complications. Fluoroscopy showed no pneumothorax. Minimal bleeding controlled with cold saline.

PLAN:
Observe in PACU then home same day. Arrange oncology and surgical consultations pending pathology.
